qas.question: How many works of a cappella in musical theater have been successful in Off-Broadway productions?

context: <b5_0>A cappella<b5_0/> has been used as the sole orchestration for original works of musical theater that have had commercial runs Off-Broadway (theaters in New York City with 99 to 500 seats) only <a0_0>four<a0_0/> times. The first was <a1_0><b6_0><b7_0><b8_0><b9_0>Avenue X<b9_0/><b8_0/><b7_0/><b6_0/><a1_0/> which opened on <b10_0>28 January 1994<b10_0/> and ran for <a3_0><b11_0>77<b11_0/><a3_0/> performances. It was produced by Playwrights Horizons with book by John Jiler, music and lyrics by <a4_0>Ray Leslee<a4_0/>. The musical style of the show's score was primarily <b12_0>Doo-Wop<b12_0/> as the plot revolved around Doo-Wop group singers of <a2_0>the 1960s<a2_0/>.
